content.title: IMMEDIATE ACTION
steps: STOP using all water in the property immediately (toilets, sinks, showers)
Turn off washing machine/dishwasher if running
If sewage backing up: evacuate area, open windows
Put towels down to contain water spread
Locate your main drain (usually outside, under manhole cover)
Call emergency drainage specialist if sewage involved or multiple drains blocked

content.text: Step 2: Clearance Method (You Pay for This)
**Simple rodding (Â£80-Â£150):** Push flexible rods through drain to break up blockage. Works for soft blockages (wipes, toilet paper, fat).
**High-pressure jetting (Â£150-Â£350):** Blast water at high pressure to clear stubborn blockages. Works for grease, roots, scale buildup.
**CCTV survey (Â£100-Â£250):** Camera inspection to find blockage location or damage. Needed for recurring blockages or suspected pipe damage.
**Root cutting (Â£200-Â£500):** If tree roots growing into pipes, need cutting head + jetting.
**Excavation + repair (Â£800-Â£3,000+):** If pipe collapsed or badly damaged, need to dig up and replace section.

content.text: How to Prevent Blocked Drains (Save Money)

items: **Never flush:** Wet wipes (even 'flushable' ones), sanitary products, cotton buds, dental floss, condoms, nappies
**Never pour down sink:** Cooking fat/oil (collect in jar, bin it), coffee grounds, rice/pasta
**Use sink strainers:** Catch food debris, hair (Â£2-Â£5 from B&Q)
**Monthly maintenance:** Pour boiling water + baking soda down drains
**Check manholes:** Lift cover once a year, check for debris/roots
**Trim trees:** Keep roots away from drain runs (willows/poplars are worst)
